snippet: During an extended argument, the justices occasionally paused to acknowledge realities outside the courtroom in connection with the president’s plan to shield millions from deportation.
abstract: Supreme Court justices appear to be split during argument over challenge to Pres Obama's plan to shield millions of undocumented immigrants from deportation and allow them to work in United States legally; outcome of case could produce significant ruling on immigration policy and reach of presidential power.

byline.original: By ADAM LIPTAK and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

lead_paragraph: During an extended argument, the justices occasionally paused to acknowledge realities outside the courtroom in connection with the president’s plan to shield millions from deportation.

headline.main: Obama Immigration Plan Seems to Divide Supreme Court
headline.print_headline: Justices Divided on Obama’s Plan for Immigrants
